forecast.name: Today
forecast.shortForecast: Partly Sunny then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 53, with temperatures falling to around 51 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 3 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Cloudy. Low around 43, with temperatures rising to around 46 overnight. East southeast wind 6 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a subtle chill lingers in the air, hinting at the day ahead. The skyline, shrouded lightly in a veil of marine layer, provides a dramatic backdrop—a tale of muted colors and promise of change. As the sun ascends, it dances momentarily with the clouds, allowing brief glimpses of a partially sunny expanse before the forecasted rain makes its appearance later in the afternoon. A gentle wind stirs from the west, carrying with it the unmistakable scent of sea and earth, forecasted rain barely whispering in the wings.

As the hours unfold, expect the weather to transition; skies will darken, clouds knitting tighter together, and the likelihood of rain will heighten, especially this evening. Those venturing out would be wise to layer their attire—think cozy jackets and perhaps a light scarf to ward off the coolness, especially as temperatures are expected to dip into the low forties later tonight. With nature prepared to wash the city clean, the day invites you to indulge in artful endeavors indoors. Why not explore a quaint café tucked away in a bustling corner, allowing the gentle rise of fresh-brewed coffee to envelop you, or lose yourself in the pages of a book, the rain a comforting soundtrack to a day well spent?
